intro: Leptactina delagoensis subsp. bussei, commonly known as the Delagoa Bussei Spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has simple, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
